ResearchProjectDef.label: basic petalace crafting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to craft basic petalace at the petalace crafting bench.\n\nPetalaces may attract nearby spiribirds, who will leave some pollen behind on the petalace. This pollen will empower the petalace, conferring a buff to the wearer. The strength of the buff depends on both the type, and quality, of the petalace.

ResearchProjectDef.label: split petalace crafting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to craft split petalace at the petalace crafting bench.\n\nThese petalaces have an affinity towards two colours of spiribird pollen, but subsequently have a decreased affinity towards all other colours.

ResearchProjectDef.label: pure petalace crafting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to craft pure petalace at the petalace crafting bench.\n\nThese petalaces have an increased affinity towards a single colour, at the cost of their affinity towards other colours.

ResearchProjectDef.label: prism petalace crafting
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to craft prism petalace at the petalace crafting bench.\n\nThese petalaces have a reasonable affinity towards all spiribird pollen colours.

ResearchProjectDef.label: spiribush sowing
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn how to sow spiribush.\n\nSown spiribush is less likely to attract wild spiribirds, as such there is a decreased chance spiribirds will emerge from the bush when it is harvested.
